text: The Battle of Nola was a battle during the Social War (91–88 BC) in which the Romans defeated a rebel force under Cluentius. After the battle was won, the Romans chased the rebels to Nola, which kept its gate shut. 23,000 rebels were killed during their flight and before the gates of Nola. ==References== Category:80s BC conflicts Category:1st century BC in the Roman Republic Category:Battles involving the Roman Republic Category:Metropolitan City of Naples
title: Battle of Nola (89 BC)
